The bank will also extend working hours across branches for senior citizens from March 19 to March 27 to minimise crowd amid the coronavirus outbreak. Following the moratorium being lifted at 6pm on Wednesday, customers could access the full range of banking online services and ATMs.

“Only a third of depositors who could withdraw up to Rs 50,000 during the moratorium, withdrew their money. This gives us confidence,” said Prashant Kumar, the RBI-appointed administrator who is set to take charge as the bank’s CEO. He added that the lender had reached out to some depositors who expressed willingness to put in more deposits given the new ownership of the bank. Kumar added that its ATMs and branches were all loaded with cash.

At the ATMs TOI visited, no major queues were witnessed at 6pm. Some customers complained on social media that they were finding it difficult to access net banking. However, TOI was able to conduct transactions online. The bank said its credit card services were also activated.

SBI, which holds 46% in Yes Bank, will not sell a single share for three years, SBI chairman Rajnish Kumar had said on Tuesday. This was despite its mandate to hold a minimum of 26% in the bank. This is the first time that the RBI is relaunching a failed bank after recapitalising it with new owners. Prior to this, all failed banks were amalgamated with public sector banks.

Title: Fatuha shootout: Police detain 12 family members
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Even after 24 hours, police are yet to get any clue as to why Deepak Mahto’s (35) family cremated his body after he was shot dead near Govindpur village under the Fatuha police station area in Patna on Tuesday.

Police have detained nearly a dozen family members including Mahto’s father for interrogation from Gulbi Ghat while they were cremating his body. However, they are continuously trying to mislead the police by frequently changing their statements. Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma said by the time police reached Gulbi Ghat, almost 80% of the body was burned in the process of cremation.

“We don’t know how much evidence will surface from the postmortem of the remaining body,” the SSP said.

Sharma said it is clear that Mahto was on the spot when the firing took place. “He was rushed to a private hospital where doctors declared him brought dead citing stab injury. However, family members are repeatedly telling police that he had died of a heart attack,” the SSP said adding, Family members, who are involved in destroying evidences, will be arrested once the fact comes to the fore.”

The SSP said that the role of the doctor in the incident is also under investigation as to how he gave the report of death due to stabbing and did not inform the police. Even Mahto’s brother did not appear before the police after the incident and his cellphone is also switched off.

Meanwhile, Fatuha SDPO Maneesh said at least 10 cases of murder, extortion and other crime are lodged against Mahto with the Agamkuan police station. “He had been to jail several times. We are looking if more cases are lodged against him with other police stations also,” he said adding an FIR was yet to be lodged in connection with the incident.

The SDPO said that CCTV camera footages had surfaced before police where Mahto could be seen being taken out of the car near hospital. “His family had kept that car hidden from police but we are trying to find it. We suspect there must be blood stains inside the car and some other evidences,” he said.

Police also said that Maneesh was also involved in property dealing. “We are also investigating from that angle,” he said.

Title: Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi announces relief for tax defaulters till March 25
Content:
PATNA:Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday announced a big relief for tax defaulters as no stringent action would be taken against them, if they cleared 35% of the tax dues owed to the state government.

Modi said the government has decided to give the relief and relaxation to comply with the advice of the Patna high court, and also in view of the current trade scenario and situation in the state. He appealed to the tax defaulters to take the benefit of the relief and relaxation that the government has announced.

As to another relief to the tax payers burdened by the tax disputes before the goods and services tax (GST) regime came into force (or with regard to the pre-GST tax disputes), Modi said the period of the one-time settlement (OTS) scheme for them has been extended up to March 25.

So far, as many as 21,000 such tax payers have applied for the resolution of their pre-GST tax disputes, Modi said, adding that the remaining such persons should also come forward to avail the OTS scheme.

Modi said as many as Rs23,055 crore worth of taxes have been netted by the commercial taxes department till March 18 against the overall tax target of Rs25,000 crore fixed for the 2019-20 financial year. He appealed to the tax payers to pay their taxes in time, so that the taxes collected could be channelized in carrying out various developmental activities in the state.

Title: Bihar: All five candidates elected to Rajya Sabha unopposed
Content:
Harivansh Narayan Singh (ANI photo)

PATNA: All the five candidates for the equal number of Rajya Sabha seats from the state assembly constituency were elected unopposed on Wednesday. Three of them are from the NDA and two from the RJD.

The five Rajya seats from the state were to fall vacant in the first week of April. The filing of nomination papers had begun on March 6, with the last date for it being March 13, followed by the scrutiny of papers on March 17 and the withdrawal of names by any candidate the next day.

The NDA candidates elected were Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh Narayan Singh and sitting MP Ram Nath Thakur from JD(U) and BJP’s Vivek Thakur, son of the outgoing Rajya Sabha member Dr C P Thakur. Similarly, RJD nominees Prem Chand Gupta and Amrendra Dhari Singh were also elected as there was no sixth candidate in the fray.

The secretary of state assembly secretariat, Bateshwar Nath Pandey, gave each of them the certificates of their election.

While the RJD nominees had filed their nomination papers on March 12, the three NDA candidates did it on March 13. Wednesday being the last date for the withdrawal of names till 3pm, all the five were declared elected unopposed at 3.30pm.

The salient feature of the biennial elections for the Rajya Sabha seats was that the candidate selection in the NDA was a seamless exercise, unlike that in the grand alliance, where there were three other claimants over and above from the RJD, like former Union minister Sharad Yadav from the Loktantrik Janata Dal, Upendra Kushwaha from the Rashtriya Lok Samata Party (RLSP) and also one from the Congress. However, the RJD fielded its two nominees unilaterally.

Title: Bihar: 43,000 train tickets cancelled, Danapur division takes Rs 2.4 crore hit
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

PATNA: The railways has suffered a revenue loss of Rs 2.39crore due to cancellation of tickets by passengers owing to the Covid-19 scare.

Coronavirus in India live updates

Danapur DRM Sunil Kumar said, “Around 43,266 people cancelled their tickets between March 1 and March 16 and got refunds from the passenger reservation system (PRS) counters located at various places in the division. The railways has so far refunded about Rs 2.39 crore in the past 16 days.”

Sources said the majority of cancellations were reported in New Delhi-bound trains from Patna Junction followed by Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune, Secunderabad, Chennai and Jaipur. On March 14, 5,756 cancellations were done followed by 4,630 and 7166 on March 15 and 16 respectively in Danapur division alone.

As advised by the Railway Board, the East Central Railway (ECR) has increased platform ticket rate from Rs10 to Rs50 per person from March 19 midnight at 13 stations of Danapur division — Patna Junction, Danapur, Rajendra Nagar Terminal, Pataliputra Junction, Patna Sahib, Bakhtiarpur, Barh, Ara, Buxar, Mokama, Jehanabad, Biharsharif and Rajgir.

Kumar said, “The railways took this decision to reduce huge gathering of people on platforms at a time when the deadly Covid-19 has been declared a pandemic.”

He added, “This temporary hike in platform ticket rate will check unnecessary entry of people who are visiting railway platforms either to receive or see off their relatives at the stations.”

Patna Junction gets about one lakh passengers every day. As many as 280 pairs of passenger trains either originate or pass through Danapur division every day. “Rajendra Nagar Terminal, Pataliputra Junction and Danapur are other major stations of the division where passenger rush has of late increased,” he said, adding, Buxar, Ara, Mokama, Rajgir and Jehanabad are other places where maximum precautionary measures are being taken.

According to ECR chief PRO Rajesh Kumar, railways has started using thermal scanners at its headquarters in Hajipur for all its officials and employees as a precautionary measure. “Hand sanitizers are provided at each entry point of the ECR headquarters,” he said, adding, railways has issued an ‘dos and don’ts’ advisory to every divisional office in the zone on the Covid-19 scare.

Platform ticket price hiked to Rs 50 at 50 railway stations: The East Central Railway (ECR) has decided to increase platform ticket price from Rs10 to Rs50 per person at 50 stations under its jurisdiction from Thursday midnight to discourage unnecessary gathering of people on railway platforms due to Covid-19 scare. The number of these 50 stations included 13 stations under the Danapur division.

According to ECR chief public relations officer (CPRO) Rajesh Kumar, railways has increased platform ticket price at Pt Deendayal Upadhyaya Junction, Gaya, Sasaram, Dehri-on-Sone, Anugrah Narayan Road and Bhabhua Road under Mughalsarai division, Dhanbad, Gomoh, Singrauli, Parasnath, Koderma, Daltonganj, Chandrapura, Barkakana, Garhwah Road, Renukut and Chopan under Dhanbad division of the ECR, he said.

Similarly, platform ticket price has been increased to Rs50 per person at Muzaffarpur, Barauni, Hajipur, Khagaria, Sonepur, Begusarai, Mansi and Naugachia under Sonepur division and at Saharsa, Samastipur, Darbhanga, Raxaul, Laheriasarai, Sitamarhi, Bapudham Motihari, Bettiah, Jaynagar, Narkatiaganj, Sagauli and Madhubani stations, the CPRO said.

Title: DGCA hearing on flight path obstruction postponed
Content:
DGCA had earlier served notices for personal hearing to about 198 buildings in 48 projects in Vesu to appear f... Read More

SURAT: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has postponed the personal hearing of the residents and builders of the 48 high-rise residential projects for height obstructions at runway of the Surat airport on March 19.

In a communication to the residents and builders on Wednesday, the DGCA authorities stated that the personal hearing at Surat was postponed till further notice following the coronavirus outbreak.

The DGCA had earlier served notices for personal hearing to about 198 buildings in 48 projects located in the Vesu area.

The personal hearing was organised after the Gujarat high court ordered to take up the issue of the building height obstruction at the war footing.

The HC has taken up the issue of construction of 1 metre to 14.3 metres higher than the permissible limits in the inner horizontal surface limit. It has deprecated the inaction on the part of the AAI and the SMC for their inaction after issuing notices for the demolition of construction of the buildings which do not even have Building Use Permission (BUC).

Vipul Shah, a resident of one of the affected buildings told TOI, “The DGCA has postponed the hearing due to coronavirus outbreak. The next date will be announced for the hearing.”

Meanwhile, Congress MLA from Mandvi assembly constituency, Anand Chaudhary had raised the Surat airport issue in the state Assembly. Chaudhary stated that the Civil Aviation Ministry had written a letter to state government informing about the illegal buildings obstructing the height at Surat airport Runway.

Chaudhary demanded a reply from the government whether any action has been taken by the government against the illegal constructions and those responsible. However, the state government replied that the Airports Authority of India (AAI) had issued no-objection certificates (NOCs) to the buildings at the time of building plan approval and that the case is pending in the Gujarat high court.

Title: Screening of passengers arriving from Mumbai starts at Surat railway station
Content: SURAT: The authorities at Surat railway station has started the thermal screening of passengers especially those who are arriving from Mumbai , in the morning and late night trains for checking of coronavirus symptoms.According to railway sources, couple of trains including Gujarat Queen, Shatabdi Express, Mumbai-Surat intercity, Jammu Tavi Express, Garib Rath Express, Deluxe Express and Rajdhani Express have been identified for mandatory screening of passengers travelling from Mumbai.Official sources said that the Surat Municipal Corporation ( SMC ) has deputed two teams of para-medical staffs along with doctors for the thermal screening of the passengers.CR Garuda, area railway manager (ARM), Surat railway station, said, “Passengers travel to Surat by morning or late night trains after arriving at Mumbai airport. We have started the thermal screening of passengers travelling from Mumbai as part of precautionary measure to stem the spread of coronavirus”“The SMC has provided us with two medical personnels for checking the passengers at the railway station, ” Garuda added.According to Garuda, the sanitisation exercise has been intensified at all the platforms, passenger waiting areas , ticket windows and reservation counters. All benches, railings, elevators are being sanitised on regular basis to stop the spread of coronavirus.“We are giving special attention for sanitising areas in public use on regular basis. The railway staffers are continuously disinfecting the touch points throughout the day,” said Garuda.

Title: IIT-BHU students asked to vacate hostels by March 21
Content:
Varanasi: The Indian Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University ( IIT-BHU ) has directed all the students to vacate the hostels by March 21 evening and return to their homes in view of safety from coronavirus. The mess facility in the hostels would be also stopped from March 21 evening.

Until then the IIT-BHU administration has asked the students to remain confined to their hostel rooms and avoid gatherings for social distancing. Meanwhile, all the classes remained suspended on the campus.

A meeting of the task force, constituted for prevention of coronavirus (Covid-19) was chaired by director of the institute Prof Pramod Kumar Jain on Tuesday. Decisions taken during the meeting included closure of cafeteria and coffee shops on the campus and to ask the students residing on the campus to vacate the hostels and return to their homes for safety concern.

Students, who have gone to their homes, have been asked to not return to the hostel until further communication in this regard, said the institute administration. All employees and students have been advised to avoid mass gathering in the mess, library, cafeteria, T-stall, other food stalls and public places. In addition, research students/ M Tech students have been asked to continue their research work by staying in contact with their supervisor via email so that research work does not suffer.

Meanwhile, the BHU administration, which has already suspended all the classes till March 31, has also asked the hostel inmates to vacate the rooms by March 31, as mess service would be stopped.

Uday Pratap College has also suspended all the classes and postponed all its entrance examinations till further orders. Principal of the college Sangeeta Kumar said that the fresh dates of examinations would be announced through college website.

Title: Multi-cornered fights on cards for HCBA polls
Content:
Nagpur: About 37 lawyers have filed nomination forms for various posts in the upcoming High Court Bar Association (HCBA) polls which have now been deferred to April 17 due to coronavirus threat.

All of them are either from various groups or contesting as an independent. Wednesday was the last day for nomination while March 23 is for withdrawal.

According to HCBA members, an interesting battle is on the cards even as no big names are in the fray unlike 2017 polls. As reported by TOI earlier, there will be multi-cornered fights for all posts. Though the last date for finalizing names has been extended, many aspirants have already started campaigning.

For the top post of president, as many as five candidates are in contention. They include Atul Pande, Shridhar Purohit and Kantilal Dhote, besides Sameer Sohoni, who’s being projected by a group led by lawyer Shreerang Bhandarkar. VG Bhamburkar, who has contested many polls, albeit unsuccessfully, is trying his luck this time as well.

For secretary’s post, Amol Jaltare and Rugved Dhore have filed nominations. For two posts of vice-presidents, there is a battle between Shreeganesh Abhyankar, Sharad Bhattad, Rajesh Nayak and Pankaj Tidke. There is a straight contest for treasurer’s post between Mangesh Bute and Shriram Deoras.

According to lawyers, the candidates started campaigning since long and it was at its peak during the two-day Holi festival. Many of them were throwing lavish parties to woo the voters, particularly the younger ones. However, those were clandestinely being held either at the contestant’s home or at farmhouse, away from the city, to escape the limelight.
